channel.title: Daily News Feed Update #1
channel.description: Daily collected titles from multiple sources

item.title: English Editorials (Update #1) • Two years since the Al-Aqsa Flood • Intensify drive to combat dengue

Magazines (Update #1) • Supreme Court Weighs Colorado’s Ban on Scientifically Discredited ‘Conversion Therapy’ • Babies’ Brains Recognize Foreign Languages They Heard before Birth • First-of-Its-Kind Kidney Transplant Could Lead to More Cross-Blood Type Donations • 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics Goes to Researchers Who Brought Quantum Mechanics into the Macroscale World • South Africa’s Coast Is Rising—And Scientists Have a New Explanation Why • There are five types of sleep – here's what that means for your health • Is the universe really one big black hole? • One of Earth’s most vital carbon sinks is faltering. Can we save it? • Biodegradable plastic made from bamboo is strong and easy to recycle • Nobel prize for physics goes to trio behind quantum computing chips

International (Update #1) • New Zealand oceans warming 34% faster than global average, putting homes and industry at risk, report finds • Indonesia school collapse: search for victims ends as 67 confirmed dead • Australia politics live: Price says leaks risk Liberals looking like ‘clown show’; police warn of potential ‘disaster’ at Gaza rally • Alleged ‘kill team’ charged after arrest en route to hit near Sydney daycare • NSW official admits hiding in cupboard during multimillion-dollar kickback investigation • Media and political attacks on Australia’s emissions targets ‘straight out of the climate obstruction playbook’, expert says • Women carry a higher genetic risk of depression, new study says • Gisèle Pelicot’s ex-husband tells court man convicted of rape knew she was sedated • Denmark plans social media ban for under-15s as PM warns phones ‘stealing childhood’ • EU plan to match Trump steel tariffs spurs ‘existential threat’ to UK steel industry • Macron under pressure to call snap parliamentary elections or resign • Far-right National Rally snubs French PM’s bid to salvage cabinet amid political turmoil – as it happened • Mamdani attends Israelis for Peace vigil after his 7 October statement draws ire from Israel • US delegation led by Steve Witkoff due to arrive in Egypt for Gaza talks • Israel marks two years since 7 October Hamas attack as Gaza ceasefire talks continue – as it happened • Diplomacy’s lowest point: how the Israel-Gaza conflict was mishandled • Israelis gather to mark two years since 7 October Hamas attack that killed 1,200 • One in three UK workers have called in sick after work drinks, survey finds • Lifetime of earnings not enough for UK workers to join wealthiest 10%, report says • Green groups criticise plans to weaken protections for English national parks • Brexit has done nothing to stem sharp decline of UK fish populations, shows study • A British Ice and more stop and search: Badenoch’s Tories set out new policies • Oregon’s governor says she told Kristi Noem ‘there is no insurrection in Oregon’ – as it happened • Dolly Parton ‘going to be just fine’, singer’s sister says as she calls for prayers amid health problems • Tesla debuts ‘affordable’ Model Y and 3 in US that strike some as too expensive • Thirty Bob Ross paintings to be sold at auction to help fund public TV stations • Glacier melt will lead to ice-free peaks in California for first time in human history
